item.title: Mid-week sowing
item.description: Sunshine at last! The UK has finally remembered it is spring! I celebrated by pressure washing the garden paths. Very rock and roll. I also did an inspection of the plants to see how they were getting on. Trees Both nectarine (varierty Harco) and the plum tree are in full flower. The plum tree is in it’s third spring now. I bought 5 dwarf fruit trees (2x apple - gala and golden delicious, 1 cherry - Stella, 1 plum - Stanley and 1 pear) in the first winter of moving here.

item.title: DHT22 success!
item.description: More Pi fun So after yesterday’s massive fail, I decided to go with (https://www.hackster.io/adamgarbo/raspberry-pi-2-iot-thingspeak-dht22-sensor-b208f4). It took me around 5 minutes to set up. Boo! I wanted to use the other one because I was interested in the MySQL side of things. Therefore, this is a temporary measure and I will do my own programming to get it working. I’ve been working on a similar project in work to collect data, store it in a DB and write it to the php script so I will have to rememeber how to do that.

item.title: Raspberry Pi fun
item.description: Today I tried to set up my Pi and the DHT22 sensor. It was all going to well in the beginning. The stuff I ordered from eBay arrived really fast (see references section for supplier details) and I was bright eyed and bushy tailed this morning at 10am. Problem number 1: I have no idea about electronics To elaborate, I tried to use a couple of really great tutorials I found online, to help set up the sensor and store the data in a mysql database.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to my gardening blog! I am writing this blog to document my experiments with growing fruit and vegetables in my garden. I completed my PhD in September 2017 and I want to continue nurturing my love of plants! I have been growing edibles for around 4 years, but have loved plants for a long time. I had the pleasure of doing a placement year at the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew (2010 - 2011) when I was studying for my BSc.
